text: The 1962–63 Taça de Portugal was the 23rd edition of the Portuguese football knockout tournament, organized by the Portuguese Football Federation (FPF). The 1962–63 Taça de Portugal began on 23 September 1962. The final was played on 30 June 1963 at the Estádio Nacional. Benfica were the previous holders, having defeated Vitória de Setúbal 3–0 in the previous season's final. Defending champions Benfica were eliminated in the semi-finals by Sporting CP. Sporting CP defeated Vitória de Guimarães, 4–0 in the final to win their sixth Taça de Portugal. ==First round== Teams from the Primeira Liga (I) and the Portuguese Second Division (II) entered at this stage. |} ==Second round== Vitória de Guimarães took a bye to the next round. |} ==Third round== Ties were played between the 19–26 May. Benfica took a bye to the next round. |} ==Quarter-finals== Ties were played between the 2–9 June. Mozambican side Sporting de Lourenço Marques and União da Madeira were invited to participate in the competition. |} ==Semi-finals== Ties were played between the 16–23 June. |} ==Final== ==References== Category:Taça de Portugal Category:1962–63 domestic association football cups Taca
title: 1962–63 Taça de Portugal
